title: Byju's auditor BDO resigns a year after Deloitte’s exit: a timeline of events
description: Troubled edtech company Byju's said in a statement that its auditing firm, MSKA Associates, an affiliate of BDO International, resigned because Byju's refused to backdate its financial reports. The auditing firm informed the company's board of its resignation as the statutory auditor, although it had been appointed for a five-year term set to end in FY27.
content: Edtech major Byju's said on Saturday that its audit firm, MSKA Associates, an affiliate of BDO International, has resigned. This is the second auditor to step down from the embattled firm since June 2023, when Deloitte had left citing governance concerns.Here's a timeline of events:-Amid the tiff with US lenders over the $1.2 billion term loan, three members of Byju's board -- early backer GV Ravishankar, managing director at Peak XV Partners, Russell Dreisenstock of Prosus (previously Naspers) and Chan Zuckerberg Initiative’s Vivian Wu-- stepped down in June 2023.At the same time, statutory auditors Deloitte Haskins tendered their resignation citing a long delay by the latter in furnishing audited financial statements for the year ended March 31, 2022.
